sect3.title: Keyboard Layouts
sect3.para:
GNOME &version; makes it easier to use multiple keyboard layouts. For instance, you might want to change from a U.S. English keyboard layout to a Russian keyboard layout, and then back again, to enter one Russian word in the middle of an english sentence. This is particularly useful to the millions of people in the world who regularly communicate in more than one language. You could click on the Keyboard Indicator panel applet to switch layouts, or you might choose a key combination instead, such as pressing both shift keys together.
Keyboard Preferences - Layouts
The Layouts tab, in the Keyboard Preferences control panel.

GNOME &version; also integrates the multimedia keys into the regular Keyboard Shortcuts control panel, making it easy to use your keyboard's special keys to change volume or control music or video applications. This functionality was previously in the Acme utility.
Keyboard Shortcuts
The Keyboard Shortcuts control panel.

sect3.title: Desktop Background
sect3.para:
GNOME &version; has a new easy-to-use Desktop Background control panel, which you can access quickly by right-clicking on the desktop. When you add new pictures, it will remember whether each one should be scaled or tiled.
Desktop Background
The Desktop Background control panel.
